title: PSG delivers a stoppage-time stunner to advance to semis
description: Paris Saint-Germain scored two late goals to knock Atalanta out of the Champions League, booking its place in the semifinals of the competition.

title: Why Trump keeps calling women 'nasty'
description: Donald Trump has a "nasty" problem.

title: Republicans rush to condemn Kamala Harris, but their message is all over the place
description: Kamala Harris is a socialist.

title: The Republican Senate nightmare is coming true
description: At the start of the 2020 election cycle -- way back in December 2018 -- the conventional wisdom was that while Democrats might be able to retake the Senate majority, it was a long shot.

title: Police pull guns on 3 teens after misidentifying suspect
description: Three teenagers in Santa Clarita, Ca were held at gunpoint and detained after police mistook them for their alleged attacker.

title: Southwest Airlines removes autistic boy and his family over face mask
description: Southwest Airlines removed a passenger and her 3-year-old son from a Monday flight after the boy, who has autism, refused to wear a face mask and became upset.

title: Dr. Sanjay Gupta: Why I am not sending my kids back to school
description: One of the questions I am getting more than any other: Am I going to send my children back to school? As a father of three teen and preteen girls, this has been a constant discussion in our household, and it hasn't been easy. My girls want to go back to school, and they are placing enormous pressure on us parents to make it so. They miss their friends, the social structure and the immersion in humanity that kids need and crave at this age. Virtual learning has played an important role for them, but it is not a substitute for in-person learning, especially for younger kids. As things stand now, my children are scheduled to start school next week.

title: Pop star asked senior citizens if they knew her. See what they said
description: Singer Dua Lipa interviewed a group of senior citizens while guest-hosting "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" and found out they have no idea who she is.

title: Microsoft's new phone is ... $1,400? Why?
description: Microsoft's first Android phone, the Surface Duo, is coming on September 10, the company announced Wednesday.

title: Huge 'GoldenEye' telescope dish is damaged
description: The famous observatory in Arecibo, Puerto Rico, featured in the James Bond movie "GoldenEye," has been forced to temporarily close after a broken cable smashed through the side of its massive dish.

title: Viola Davis proudly 'owns' her story
description: Viola Davis gave us all a gift in honor of her 55th birthday.

title: Huge oil leak is destroying pristine lagoon
description: Mauritius is facing an environmental catastrophe after a stricken Japanese-owned ship began leaking oil into the ocean.

title: Tourism collapse has consequences for wildlife
description: Two decades ago, Rosa María Ruiz purchased 4,000 hectares (9,885 acres) of land along the Beni River, near the small village of Rurrenabaque, with the goal of transforming it from a heavily logged patch of the Bolivian Amazon into a thriving private wildlife reserve.

title: Volunteers pick up the pieces as Beirut cries out for help rebuilding
description: Volunteer efforts on the ground in Beirut, Lebanon, are filling the void left by the state, which has allocated just $66 million to estimated damage worth $5 billion, according to the government of Beirut. CNN's Ben Wedeman reports.

title: How to tell if your child is sick from Covid-19, based on pediatricians' advice
description: Are parents really supposed to be reassured by all this talk about "mild" cases of Covid-19 in children? What about the unfortunate "few" youngsters who have died or come down with a strange and severe associated illness?

title: Democratic women and women of color, who are the party's driving force, will see themselves represented
UK crashes into deepest recession of any major economy
description: UK economic output shrank by 20.4% in the second quarter of 2020, the worst quarterly slump on record, pushing the country into the deepest recession of any major global economy.

title: Americans' confidence in police falls to its lowest level in nearly three decades, new Gallup poll shows
description: Americans' confidence in police has hit a new low -- aided in large part by a growing gap between Black and White people about how much they trust officers.

title: Do TikTok and WeChat pose real threats to national security?
description: President Donald Trump made good on his threat to crack down on two popular Chinese-owned social media apps -- TikTok & WeChat -- on grounds of national security, issuing executive orders that would ban the apps in 45 days if they are not sold by their parent companies. CNN's Selina Wang speaks to security experts on whether the two apps pose any real threats.

title: Try this 5-minute yoga routine before bedtime
description: Having a morning routine to boost energy is a great way to start the day, but what if you wake up every morning knowing that your bedtime routine is really to blame for your lack of energy and focus?

title: Pregnant amid the pandemic: The highs and lows
description: In early February, my partner and I discovered that I was pregnant.

title: Russia's unproven Covid-19 vaccine will be available to other countries by November, funder says. But safety concerns remain
Russian CEO has a vaccine rollout plan that made Dr. Gupta suspicious
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper and Dr. Sanjay Gupta discuss their interview with Russia Direct Investment Fund CEO Kirill Dmitriev following Russian President Vladimir Putin's announcement about the approval of a coronavirus vaccine amid unanswered questions over its safety.

title: As tensions rise in Asia Pacific, South Korea is building its first aircraft carrier ... complete with US-made F-35B fighter jets
description: South Korea plans to start building its first aircraft carrier next year, and acquire fighter jets to operate on it, the country's Defense Ministry has announced.

title: New dinosaur species related to Tyrannosaurus rex discovered by scientists in England
description: A new species of dinosaur related to the Tyrannosaurus rex has been discovered in England.

title: Was this 'the biggest mistake in sports history'?
description: When dreams clash with reality; when life reaches a daunting crossroads; when we must decide whether to be or make history.

title: Putin attempts to turn Covid-19 vaccine into new Cold War
description:

title: Widower installs wax statue of late wife in dream home she tragically never got to see
description: An Indian widower has installed a life-sized wax statue of his late wife in the dream house they were building together before she died.

title: Biden just sent an unmistakable message
description: Joe Biden thinks he is going to win the White House in 84 days' time.

title: Ilhan Omar defeats Democratic primary challenger in Minnesota, CNN projects
description: Democratic Rep. Ilhan Omar, a member of the progressive "Squad" in Congress, defeated a well-funded challenger in a Minnesota Democratic primary on Tuesday, CNN projected.

title: Trump turns to stereotypes as he responds to Harris pick
description: It took President Donald Trump less than two minutes to reach for the word "nasty" as he reacted to California Sen. Kamala Harris' historic selection as the first Black woman to join a major-party ticket.

title: A rare giant shark now sits in an ice block at the Smithsonian, allowing researchers to hopefully unravel clues about its evolution
description: Researchers are hoping to unravel the mystery around one of the rarest sharks in the sea -- the megamouth.

title: Thousands more tons of oil from stricken ship could spill into ocean, experts fear
description: A stricken ship off the coast of Mauritius which has already leaked about 1,000 metric tons of oil into a pristine Indian Ocean lagoon could be about to break in two, experts fear -- spelling disaster for the ecologically rich area.

title: Beer unsold during Australia's coronavirus lockdown has been turned into renewable energy
description: When Australia's coronavirus lockdown forced bars and restaurants to shut down in March, breweries were left with huge inventories of unsold, stale beer.

title: The Red Bull heir, a crashed car and the scandal that angered Thailand
This company thinks bacteria can fix fashion's water pollution problem
description: In 2013, a team of Cambridge University scientists were in Nepal's Kathmandu Valley, developing a device to measure pollution in the region's waters.

title: Ex-Victoria's Secret CEO agreed to written deposition in Epstein accuser suit
description: Les Wexner, the former head of the parent company that owns Victoria's Secret, has agreed to answer written deposition questions in a lawsuit involving Jeffrey Epstein accuser Virginia Giuffre and attorney Alan Dershowitz, but Dershowitz wants him to testify in person or on camera, according to newly unsealed documents.

title: Covid-19 returns to New Zealand after 102 days
description: New Zealand has reintroduced coronavirus restrictions in parts of the country after new locally transmitted cases broke the 102-day streak the country had gone without recording a local infection.

title: The weight vice president Harris would bear
description: Biden's historic choice | Harris in photos | Opinion: Harris' key strengths

title: Dramatic aerial photos showcase China's wild 'crimson beach'
description: No bathing suits are required to enjoy this Chinese beach.

title: Who is Kamala Harris? CNN looks at her life and career in politics
description: The people she grew up with and worked with say Kamala Harris has always been a fighter. Joe Biden is counting on it.
